titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Maurice Allais Collection, 1945-2003 and undated RL.11078
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-12-10 15:24:00 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Maurice Allais collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of article offprints and monographs by and about economist Maurice Allais. It includes a range of published scholarship written by Allais, along with a small amout of lecture notes and reference articles about his life and work.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are grouped into subseries: Articles by Allais; Articles about Allais; and Lectures. All materials are arranged alphabetically within those subseries.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Maurice Allais (1911-2010) was a French economist who won the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economics in 1988. He worked almost exclusively in French, researching decision theory, monetary policy, and behavioral economics.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Maurice Allais collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2015 from Allais's daughter, Christine Allais.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Maurice Allais Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Sandra Niethardt, Ben Saalfeld, and Meghan Lyon, Oct. 2015.
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0079

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: A significant portion of the original Allais Collection was separated for individual cataloging in Rubenstein Library. Consult the library's catalog for more information.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains article offprints and monographs by and about economist Maurice Allais. Materials are listed alphabetically within 3 subseries: Articles by Allais, Articles about Allais, and Lectures by Allais. The first two subseries include publications and clippings from assorted journals, newspapers, and other periodicals. The Lectures subseries contains drafts from Allais's visit to the Thomas Jefferson Center for Studies in Political Economy in 1959.
